titleStmt.title: SII 12.198: original edition by V. Venkatasubba Ayyar
No. 198. (A.R. No. 212 of 1923). TIRUPPULIVANAM, CONJEEVERAM TALUK, CHINGLEPUT DISTRICT. ON THE NORTH WALL OF THE KITCHEN IN THE VYĀGHRAPURĪŚVARA TEMPLE.

summary.p: It is stated in this record of the 16th year that Aiyanāyaṉ alias Vīragaṅgar, son of Pichchiyār, a dēvaraḍiyāḷ attached to the temple of Tiruppulivanamuḍaiya-Nāyaṉār at Uttaramēru alias Rājēndraśōḻa-chaturvēdimaṅgalam, an independent village in Kāliyūr-kōṭṭam, a district of Jayaṅkoṇḍaśōḻa-maṇḍalam, presented 64 cows and 2 bulls to provide daily 1 uri of ghee by the measure Rājakēsari, for maintaining two perpetual lamps in the temple.

Uttaramērūr was probably called Rājēndraśōḻa-chaturvēdimaṅgalam after the Chōḷa king Rājēndra-Chōḷa I (No. 174 of 1923). Subsequently it was also known as Gaṇḍagōpāla-chaturvēdimaṅgalam (No. 183 of 1923).
The details of date given are not regular.

revisionDesc.change: Further conversion of digital encoding to DHARMA encoding scheme according to EGD (Encoding Guide for Diplomatic Editions)

div.p:
svasti śrī . cakalapuvaṉaccakkaravattikaḷ śrī kopperuñciṅkatevaṟku yāṇṭu 10 6vatu tulānāyaṟṟu
pūrvapakṣattu paurṇṇaiyum cevvāykkiḻamaiyum peṟṟa revatināḷ jayaṅkoṇṭacoḻa
maṇṭalattuk kāliyūrkkoṭṭattu taṉiyūr Uttarameruvāṉa rājendracoḻaccaturvedimaṅkalattu
Uṭaiyār tiruppulivaṉamuṭaiya nāyaṉārkku Ikkoyil tevaraṭiyāḷ picciyār makaṉ Aiya nāyaṉāṉa
virakaṅkar vaitta tirunantāviḷakku Iraṇṭukku viṭṭa pacu Aṟupattu nālum Iṣabham Iraṇṭum Ivvūr maṉṟāṭi
k kuṭimakkaḷil ceṉṉikkoṉ Aṟamaṉāṉa tiruvekampakkoṉ viḷakku kālum Ivaṉ tampi ceṉṉi viḷa
kku kālum Ivaṉ tampi coṟaṉ viḷakku kālum Amutakkoṉ tīttāṉ viḷakku kālum civa ṉakkoṉ tāḻi vi
ḷakku kālum Ivaṉ tampi piccaṉ viḷakku kālum moṇṇaikkoṉ Uṭaiyāṉ viḷakku kālum celvakkoṉ
makaṉ kovintakkoṉ viḷakku kālum Āka viḷakku 2 Ivviḷakku Iraṇṭukkum nāḷ Oṉṟu kku rājakesariyāl Aḷak
kum ney Uta Iṉney Uriyum Ittirunantāviḷakku Iraṇṭukkum candrādittar Uḷḷataṉaiyum Aḷakkakaṭavatākac
cammatittu śilālekhai paṇṇikkuṭuttom Ivvaṉaivom . Itu śrīmaheśvara rakṣai .
Digital edition of SII 12.198 by converted to DHARMA conventions by Emmanuel Francis.
